title: Energy conservation - 2 objects same q different m

content.description: Two particles, <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, have the same charge while Particle <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has twice the mass of Particle <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. If both particles are in an electric field and accelerated from rest through the same electric potential difference, how do the following quantities compare to each other?
content.question: The final kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub f" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> of the particle The magnitude <math alttext="the absolute value of delta U" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math> of the change in the electric potential energy of the particle-field system <math alttext="K sub f" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> <math alttext="the absolute value of delta U" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>|</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi><mo>|</mo></mstyle></math> A The same for both particles The same for both particle-field systems B The same for both particles Greater for the Particle <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>-field system C Greater for Particle <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> The same for both particle-field systems D Greater for Particle <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> Greater for the Particle <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>-field system

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
